item.title: Dan Neidle
item.description: We previously reported that Douglas Barrowman's companies had unlawfully hidden their ownership of PPE Medpro and the companies holding Barrowman's Belgravia house. We can now identify 25 additional companies where Barrowman's group has unlawfully failed to disclose the ownership, abetted by what appears to be a rogue company verification agent.(This isn‚Äôt the big Douglas Barrowman story we‚Äôve mentioned - that‚Äôs coming soon. Think of this as a taster...)https://www.taxpolicy.org.uk/2024/01/14/25more/

item.title: Jonathan Corbet
item.description:
It's acid-test time. Getting rid of the gas furnace and installing a #heatpump in Colorado was a bit of leap of faith, even though the consensus was that they are good enough to work in this environment now.

We're midway through a stretch of sustained sub-zero weather (as in, below 0¬∞F, not that wimpy 0¬∞ used in other parts of the world), so we are definitely putting it to the test.

So far, so good. We did put in a backup 10KW resistance strip, that that has only come on once for a few minutes as far as I can tell. Even so, it's good that we like a cooler house than many; I think it would be hard-put to sustain the sorts of temperatures that a lot of people like to keep in their houses around here.

It *has* certainly burned through a lot of electricity; our summertime surplus from the solar panels is dwindling rapidly. The hope of getting all the way through the winter on our banked electricity seems to be falling by the wayside.

Still, the goal of turning off the fossil-fuel feed to the house remains on track.

item.title: Francois Heinderyckx
item.description:
In France, @cnrs (Europe's largest public funding agency for fundamental research) unsubscribes from Elsevier's Scopus database, as a step towards relying exclusively on open solutions (whenever these solutions become available).
https://www.cnrs.fr/en/cnrsinfo/cnrs-has-unsubscribed-scopus-publications-database
#OpenAccess #OpenScience #CNRS

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Did you know we make all of the materials from our workshops and downloadable as power point /pdfs? Please feel free to reuse anything in your teaching! #opensciencehttps://workshops.psychopy.org/#open_materials

item.title: Dr Emma Kate Ward
item.description: I've easily found tech people on Mastodon but it's been harder to find #psychology and #neuroscience people, and I've noticed I followed mostly men, too. I've been consciously following new people when I see boosts, but it's really slow.Then I found this tool, which finds people who are followed by people you follow, based on public information (so no permissions required!). Really nice way to get more of a diverse feed.(And if I've just followed you today, hi!)https://followgraph.vercel.app/

item.title: Sainsbury Wellcome Centre
item.description: In a new Q&A, Dr @AliceCMo (Columbia University‚Äôs Zuckerman Mind Brain and Behavior Institute) discusses her ENSS experience at SWC and what drives her research on solving the credit assignment problem in the context of a complex multi-dimensional action.‚ÄúMy current research studies how we learn new movements. The goal is to understand how different parts of the brain are relevant for learning different aspects of a specific skill.‚ÄùRead more: https://www.sainsburywellcome.org/web/qa/reaching-rewards-how-spatial-targets-are-learned

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Ever fancied just part of our three day official workshop? We now run specific "Topics" workshops. Each workshop samples part of our three day workshop, so that you can pick and choose content for your interests. You can book tickets or apply for waivers here üëá https://workshops.psychopy.org/topics.html

item.title: Steven Strogatz
item.description: The third edition of my textbook, Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos, was published today. You can preview the first 68 pages on Google Books, or take a look at the preface below to see what's new. The main new thing is a chapter on the Kuramoto model! Hope you enjoy it.
